c74object.name: the.gl.engine
c74object.digest: Specify the gl engine a Jitter GL patch uses
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2021, www.xenorama.com.
When sharing Jitter GL patches, including the.gl.engine can ensure a user is informed about the gl engine required and prompted to change it should it not match. This object can be used as a patcher or as bpatcher with simple GUI and user notifications.

objarg.name: gl-engine
objarg.digest: Name or index of gl engine in use
objarg.description: Name or index of gl engine in use. The argument is necessary to specify an engine the patch relies on. It has to be provided as single argument though merely the index number of the respective engine is required, i.e., for gl3 both 'gl3' or the single index '3' are accepted.

attribute.name: quiet
attribute.description:
Disable autocheck flag. Should only a minor part of the patch be dependent on the gl engine in question, setting this attribute to '1' can invoke a check only when a certain setting is flagged in the user interface for this specific purpose.
The default is 0 (autocheck on launch)

attribute.name: bogusclass
attribute.digest: List unsupported externals in engine mismatch
attribute.description: List unsupported externals in engine mismatch. All Max objects found in the patcher (or any subpatcher) of any of the classes provided as arguments will be rendered bogus optically to highlight their dysfunctionality.

attribute.name: bogusvar
attribute.digest: List unsupported scripting names in engine mismatch
attribute.description: List unsupported scripting names in engine mismatch. All Max objects found in the toplevel patcher matching the scripting names provided as arguments will be rendered bogus optically to highlight their dysfunctionality.

method.name: bang
method.description: Perform gl engine check manually. Should a user cancel the gl engine change, they can still perform a new check at any time.
